metadata.title: FedRAMP System Security Plan (SSP)

roles.title: Prepared By
roles.desc: The organization that prepared this SSP. If developed in-house, this is the CSP itself.

roles.title: Prepared For
roles.desc: The organization for which this SSP was prepared. Typically the CSP.

roles.title: System Security Plan Approval
roles.desc: The individual or individuals accountable for the accuracy of this SSP.

roles.title: Information System Owner
roles.desc: The individual within the CSP who is ultimately accountable for everything related to this system.

roles.title: Authorizing Official
roles.desc: The individual or individuals who must grant this system an authorization to operate.

roles.title: Authorizing Official's Point of Contact
roles.desc: The individual representing the authorizing official.

roles.title: Information System Management Point of Contact (POC)
roles.desc: The highest level manager who responsible for system operation on behalf of the System Owner.

roles.title: Information System Technical Point of Contact
roles.desc: The individual or individuals leading the technical operation of the system.

roles.title: General Point of Contact (POC)
roles.desc: A general point of contact for the system, designated by the system owner.

roles.title: System Information System Security Officer (or Equivalent)
roles.desc: The individual accountable for the security posture of the system on behalf of the system owner.

roles.title: Privacy Official's Point of Contact
roles.desc: The individual responsible for the privacy threshold analysis and if necessary the privacy impact assessment.

roles.title: Owner of an inventory item within the system.
Administrative responsibility an inventory item within the system.
ICA POC (Local)
roles.desc: The point of contact for an interconnection on behalf of this system.
roles.remarks: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

roles.title: ICA POC (Remote)
roles.desc: The point of contact for an interconnection on behalf of this external system to which this system connects.
roles.remarks: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

roles.title: ICA Signatory (Local)
roles.desc: Responsible for signing an interconnection security agreement on behalf of this system.
roles.remarks: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

roles.title: ICA Signatory (Remote)
roles.desc: Responsible for signing an interconnection security agreement on behalf of the external system to which this system connects.
roles.remarks: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

roles.title: Consultant
roles.desc: Any consultants involved with developing or maintaining this content.

roles.title: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP) Program Management Office (PMO)
Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP) Joint Authorization Board (JAB)

locations.title: CSP HQ
locations.remarks: There must be one location identifying the CSP's primary business address, such as the CSP's HQ, or the address of the system owner's primary business location.

locations.title: Primary Data Center
locations.remarks:
There must be one location for each data center.

There must be at least two data centers.

For a data center, briefly summarize the components at this location.

All data centers must have a conformity tag of "data-center".

A primary data center must also have a conformity tag of "primary-data-center".

locations.title: Secondary Data Center
locations.remarks:
There must be one location for each data center.

There must be at least two data centers.

For a data center, briefly summarize the components at this location.

All data centers must have a conformity tag of "data-center"

An alternate or backup data center must also have a conformity tag of "alternate-data-center".

parties.party-name: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program: Program Management Office
parties.remarks: This party entry must be present in a FedRAMP SSP.\n\nThe uuid may be different; however, the uuid must be associated with the \"fedramp-pmo\" role in the responsible-party assemblies.

parties.party-name: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program: Joint Authorization Board
parties.remarks: This party entry must be present in a FedRAMP SSP.\n\nThe uuid may be different; however, the uuid must be associated with the \"fedramp-jab\" role in the responsible-party assemblies.
Generic placeholder for any external organization.
Generic placeholder for an authorizing agency.

metadata.remarks:
This OSCAL-based FedRAMP SSP Template can be used for the FedRAMP Low, Moderate, and
            High baselines.\n\nGuidance for OSCAL-based FedRAMP Tailored content has not yet been developed.

system-characteristics.description: Describe the purpose and functions of this system here.

annotations.name: cloud-service-model
annotations.remarks: Remarks are required if service model is \"other\". Optional otherwise.

annotations.name: cloud-deployment-model
annotations.remarks:
Remarks are required if deployment model is \"hybrid-cloud\" or \"other\". Optional
               otherwise.

confidentiality-impact.adjustment-justification: Required if the base and selected values do not match.

integrity-impact.adjustment-justification: Required if the base and selected values do not match.

availability-impact.adjustment-justification: Required if the base and selected values do not match.

status.remarks: Remarks are required if status/state is \"other\". Optional otherwise.

authorization-boundary.description: A holistic, top-level explanation of the FedRAMP authorization boundary.

network-architecture.description: A holistic, top-level explanation of the network architecture.

data-flow.description: A holistic, top-level explanation of the system's data flows.

leveraged-authorizations.title: Name of Underlying System
leveraged-authorizations.remarks: The leveraged-authorizaton assembly is supposed to have a required uuid flag instead of an optional id flag. This will be fixed in the syntax shortly.\n\nUse one leveraged-authorization assembly for each underlying system. (In the legacy world, these may be general support systems.

authorized-privileges.title: Portal administration
functions-performed: Create, modify and delete client applications

authorized-privileges.title: Administrative Access Approver
functions-performed: Approves access requests for administrative accounts.

authorized-privileges.title: Access Approver
functions-performed: Approves access requests for administrative accounts.

60f92bcf-f353-4236-9803-2a5d417555f4.title: This System
60f92bcf-f353-4236-9803-2a5d417555f4.description: The entire system as depicted in the system authorization boundary

e82e6e07-0c62-417e-8a19-3744991b4c65.title: Name of Leveraged System
e82e6e07-0c62-417e-8a19-3744991b4c65.description: If the leveraged system owner provides a UUID for their system (such as in an OSCAL-based CRM), it should be used as the UUID for this component.

05ceb8df-52e7-49db-9719-891723f366bd.title: [SAMPLE]Product Name
05ceb8df-52e7-49db-9719-891723f366bd.remarks: COMMENTS: Provide other comments as needed.

1541015b-6d19-42cb-a991-624cc082ed4d.title: [SAMPLE]Product
1541015b-6d19-42cb-a991-624cc082ed4d.remarks: COMMENTS: Provide other comments as needed.

annotations.name: allows-authenticated-scan
annotations.remarks: Vendor appliance. No admin-level access.

d5841417-de4c-4d84-ab3c-39dd1fd32a96.title: [SAMPLE]Service Name
d5841417-de4c-4d84-ab3c-39dd1fd32a96.purpose: Describe the reason the service is needed.
d5841417-de4c-4d84-ab3c-39dd1fd32a96.remarks: Section 10.2, Table 10-1. Ports, Protocols and Services\n\n**SERVICES ARE NOW COMPONENTS WITH type='service'**

annotations.name: connection-security
annotations.remarks: If \"other\", remarks are required. Optional otherwise.

annotations.name: allows-authenticated-scan
annotations.remarks: If no, explain why. If yes, omit remarks field.

annotations.name: is-scanned
annotations.remarks: If no, explain why. If yes, omit remarks field.

annotations.name: function
annotations.remarks: Optional, longer, formatted description.

98e37f90-fbb5-4177-badb-9b55229cc183.remarks: COMMENTS: Additional information about this item.

annotations.name: scan-authenticated
annotations.remarks: If no, explain why. If yes, omit remark.

annotations.name: scan-latest
annotations.remarks: If no, explain why. If yes, omit remark.

c916d3c5-229e-4786-bf3f-4d71baa0e7a5.remarks: COMMENTS: If needed, provide additional information about this inventory item.

annotations.name: is-scanned
annotations.remarks: Asset wasn't running at time of scan.

annotations.name: is-scanned
annotations.remarks: Asset wasn't running at time of scan.

control-implementation.description:
FedRAMP SSP Template Section 13\n\nThis description field is required by OSCAL. FedRAMP does not require any specific
            information here.

annotations.name: implementation-status
annotations.remarks: Describe the plan to complete the implementation.

ac-1_prm_1.value: [replace with list of personnel or roles]

60f92bcf-f353-4236-9803-2a5d417555f4.description: Describe how Part a is satisfied within the system.

ac-1_smt.a.remarks: The specified component is the system itself.\n\nAny control implementation response that can not be associated with another component is associated with the component representing the system.

ac-1_smt.a.1.remarks: This identifies a policy (attached in resources) that satisfies this control.

ac-1_smt.a.2.remarks: This identifies a process (attached in resources) that satisfies this control.

ac-1_smt.b.1.description: Describe how Part b-1 is satisfied.

ac-1_smt.b.2.description: Describe how Part b-2 is satisfied.

annotations.name: implementation-status
annotations.remarks: Describe the plan to complete the implementation.

annotations.name: implementation-status
annotations.remarks: Describe the portion of the control that is not satisfied.

annotations.name: implementation-status
annotations.remarks: Describe the justification for marking this control Not Applicable.

annotations.name: control-origination
annotations.remarks: Describe any customer-configured requirements for satisfying this control.

ac-2_smt.a.description: Do not respond to this statement here. Respond within the `by-component` assembly below.

60f92bcf-f353-4236-9803-2a5d417555f4.description:
For the portion of the control satisfied by this system or its owning organization, describe
                        **how** the control is met.

annotations.name: responsibility
annotations.remarks: General customer responsibility description.

60f92bcf-f353-4236-9803-2a5d417555f4.remarks:
The component-uuid above points to the "this system" component.

Any control response content that does not cleanly fit another system component is placed here. This includes customer responsibility content.

This can also be used to provide a summary, such as a holistic overview of how multiple components work together.

While the "this system" component is not expclicity required within every `statement`, it will typically be present.

b7364f67-bf65-4df2-b756-4b9c6b1c4a52.description:
For the portion inherited from an underlying FedRAMP-authorized provider,
                     describe **what** is inherited.

annotations.name: responsibility
annotations.remarks: Component-specific customer responsibility description.

cae07d12-8566-443a-95de-7596b9cac953.description:
For the portion of the control that must be configured by or provided by the
                     customer, describe the customer responsibility here. This is what will appear
                     in the Customer Responsibility Matrix.

resources.remarks:
Section 9.2, Figure 9-1 Authorization Boundary Diagram (graphic)\n\nThis should be referenced in the
               system-characteristics/authorization-boundary/diagram/link/@href flag using a value
               of \"#d2eb3c18-6754-4e3a-a933-03d289e3fad5\"

Section 9.4, Figure 9-2 Network Diagram (graphic)\n\nThis should be referenced in the
               system-characteristics/network-architecture/diagram/link/@href flag using a value
               of \"#61081e81-850b-43c1-bf43-1ecbddcb9e7f\"

Section 10, Figure 10-1 Data Flow Diagram (graphic)\n\nThis should be referenced in the
               system-characteristics/data-flow/diagram/link/@href flag using a value
               of \"#ac5d7535-f3b8-45d3-bf3b-735c82c64547\"
